Instruction: Heat up peanut oil in a deep skillet or deep-fryer until it reaches 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius), making sure there is enough oil to cover the chicken pieces halfway.
Season all sides of the chicken pieces with seasoned salt.
In a large paper bag, mix flour, salt, and black pepper. Likewise, put beaten eggs in a large bowl.
Coat the seasoned chicken with beaten egg first, then place it in the bag of seasoned flour and shake to coat.

Fry chicken in hot oil until cooked through and golden brown, about 10 minutes per side. Use a meat thermometer to ensure the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (75 degrees C). Allow the chicken to drain on a plate lined with paper towels.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in honey and cook until bubbles form, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer for another 10 minutes. Stir in pecans and cook until hot, about 2-3 minutes. Drizzle over the hot chicken pieces and serve.
